Posted By: infernox10 (7/7/2012 10:08:46 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
At his worst, he's the important half of a [Momentous Fall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Momentous Fall) for an extra {G} that doesn't lose you the creature. Even the threat of strong card draw in mono green, if you don't suicide him, can be a strong enough distraction to warrant removal or swinging, getting you a turn to attack with your presumed fatties.  
  
4.5/5

Posted By: Jake1991 (7/9/2012 8:08:18 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
M12's theme was 'Gather Your Allies'. The Planeswalkers' stories have established that nearly all the characters are well acquainted as either friends or friends of friends. Ajani is the only 'good guy' that has had close personal dealings with Bolas. (on the scale of white and black, I'm calling Jace gray. He don't count.) This Ajani is a 'Caller' of his Pride. For a while, I thought that Karn might be the next leader/driving force behind any 'New Coalition'. Some people think it's gonna be Jace, because of Return to Ravnica. Here's my view:  
  
Comparing the Planeswalkers to the Avengers, Jace is Nick Fury or Iron Man: well-connected, sends out the invites, a pretty badass douchebag. Or a pretty douchebag \*\*\*. One or the other. :P  
And he's VERY Rich, certainly much richer for his age than anyone has a right to be. Sorin and Bolas are richer...but they weren't trying too hard and they're older than dirt, so it doesn't count as much.  
  
Ajani has GOT to be the Captain America though- th... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: DarthParallax (8/28/2012 10:24:12 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Gcrudaplaneswalker: The Director? You seriously called him The Director? His name is NICK FURY and he is the single most badass Marvel character without legitimate superpowers EVER.   
  
As for Garruk here:  
  
His +1 is more than just defending himself like some other 'walkers do, the 3/3s can actually be potent offensive threats, especially in limited.   
  
His -3 is almost always going to be [Harmonize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harmonize) just based on his +1, but in green it has the potential to be so BIG, which can probably win you the game flat out with green's mana ramp (playing the fistful of cards you just drew)  
  
His -6 made me read it three times just to make sure that Wizards wasn't trolling me. I mean, c'mon, for each land you control? In the color of land fetching? SIX/SIX WURMS? If that doesn't win you the game then either you've been Wrathed and as a green mage you'd lose anyway, or you've done something SERIOUSLY wrong.   
  
5/5
posts.html:
@Gcrudaplaneswalker: The Director? You seriously called him The Director? His name is NICK FURY and he is the single most badass Marvel character without legitimate superpowers EVER.

As for Garruk here:

His +1 is more than just defending himself like some other 'walkers do, the 3/3s can actually be potent offensive threats, especially in limited.

His -3 is almost always going to be Harmonize just based on his +1, but in green it has the potential to be so BIG, which can probably win you the game flat out with green's mana ramp (playing the fistful of cards you just drew)

His -6 made me read it three times just to make sure that Wizards wasn't trolling me. I mean, c'mon, for each land you control? In the color of land fetching? SIX/SIX WURMS? If that doesn't win you the game then either you've been Wrathed and as a green mage you'd lose anyway, or you've done something SERIOUSLY wrong.

5/5
Report Abuse

No, at his worse he is for a 3/3 vanilla creature, that makes a player discard a removal. Your not going to drop him if they have 4 power + evasion, unless your desperate.

But man, his card draw is really powerful. Be careful, if they doom blade your fatty while his -3 is on the stack, you could get 2 for 1.
